title: 820-3476-A No Backlight
message:
No backlight

Some readings 

U7700
Pin 1&2 LCDBKLT_SW = 0.1v
Pin 4 LCDBKLT_FET_DRV = 0v
Pin 5 PP5V_S0_BKLT_D = 5.15v
Pin 18 PP5V_S0_BKLT_A = 5.15v
Pin 17 BKLT_EN_R = 3.34v

Thank you

title: 820-3476-A No Backlight
message:
Check BKLT_SD,
If good, check F7700.

title: 820-3476-A No Backlight
message:
12.38v bklt_sd
12.56v both sides of f7700 
Fuse has continuity

title: 820-3476-A No Backlight
message:
"12.38v bklt_sd
---------
If good"
Is NOT!

Did you try another compatible LCD assembly?
Check R7750-53 and traces.
Post voltage and diode mode on SCL/SDA lines.

title: 820-3476-A No Backlight
message:
What should BKLT_SD be to be good? LCD Assembly good tried on working MacBook.

BKLT_SCL = 4.62v  0.468
BKLT_SDA = 4.54v 0.464
R7750 to 53 all good. Traces appear fine.

title: 820-3476-A No Backlight
message:
Backlight adjust is controlled through I2C bus, via PCH -> T-CON -> U7700.
BKLT_SD must be 0V, in working state; controlled as mentioned.

Try chabging U700.
Check all its connections.
Be sure no short anywhere.

title: 820-3476-A No Backlight
message:
If you mean U7700 then I have changed it but the same problem persists. Thanks

I will check to see if there are any shorts to its connectors

title: 820-3476-A No Backlight
message: When I'm checking voltages at U7700 should I have the screen plugged in or does it not make a difference?

title: 820-3476-A No Backlight
message:
Yeah, U7700.
I supposed all previous readings are with LCD connected.
If not, wasted time...

title: 820-3476-A No Backlight
message:
Yes all readings were carried out WITHOUT screen connected.
Shall I do them again with screen connected and send them too you?

title: 820-3476-A No Backlight
message:
Of course.
How do you expect to get backlight voltage, if no LCD connected.
I already explained you the via for required communication; T-CON is inside LCD assembly!

title: 820-3476-A No Backlight
message: There was a short on PPVOUT_SO_LCDBKLT caused by a bad LVDS connector. Replaced connector and now all good. Thanks again for your help and support. Until the next one - Adios!
